channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Scoop: RNC shares first-quarter fundraising numbers, How it adds up
item.description: The RNC reports hauling in $56.1 million during the January-March first quarter of 2025 funding as the national party committee builds resources for n...

item.title: Exclusive: Revel emerges from stealth with $30 million to prevent your critical hardware from exploding—literally
item.description: Revel, a startup that builds software for controlling critical hardware, launches from stealth with $30 million in funding.

item.title: Netflix stock has been nearly unscathed by Trump tariffs. Some think it could be Silicon Valley’s version of Johnson & Johnson
item.description: As recession fears mount on Wall Street, management is still reportedly setting ambitious long-term goals.

item.title: Officials Won’t Show Public Records About Noncitizen Voters At U-Michigan
item.description: The Federalist asked where 15 likely noncitizen voters cast their ballots, but the secretary of state and attorney general refused to say.

item.title: Santander surpasses UBS as continental Europe’s biggest bank
item.description: The Spanish lender has seen its shares soar in value this year, propelling it to a market capitalization of $104 billion.

item.title: Just before Mark Zuckerberg bought Instagram, he identified a now-defunct social startup as Facebook’s biggest threat
item.description: Emails revealed during Meta's landmark antitrust case have shed light on how Zuckerberg accessed Facebook's old rivals.

item.title: Self-made millionaire and Netflix’s finance guru Ramit Sethi reveals the financial red flags that are keeping you from getting rich
item.description: Dave Ramsey says he can tell who’ll stay stuck in the middle class just by looking at their car. Ramit Sethi thinks that’s ridiculous.

item.title: Harvard under fire as DHS secretary cuts $2.7M in grants, demands visa records: 'America demands more'
item.description: DHS Secretary Kristi Noem cut $2.7M in grants to Harvard University on Wednesday, citing antisemitism and visa violations, and warned of losing foreig...

item.title: Dem senator says he will continue 'fighting for the return' of deported El Salvadoran man: 'Won't rest'

item.title: Trump hosts faith leaders for Easter prayer dinner, slams effort to rid America of Christian principles
item.description: President Donald Trump participated in an Easter prayer service and dinner Wednesday night with several members of various faith communities.

item.description: Sen. Chris Van Hollen made a pilgrimage to El Salvador Wednesday to demand the country release Kilmar Abrego Garcia, whom the U.S. deported last month...

item.title: Trump, U.S. officials meet with first-in-line Japan on tariff relief

item.title: To Save Medicaid, We Have to Cut It
item.description: Medicaid reform doesn’t mean abandoning the disadvantaged.

item.title: A Minecraft Movie Fights Cultural Inertia with Joy
item.description: Jared Hess’s gamer movie dreams of capitalist innovation.

item.title: Free Traders Are Talking Past the Working Class
item.description: The free trade case is correct. But free traders need to frame their arguments differently.

item.title: Democrats Drop Everything To Bring Back A Deported Illegal Alien

item.title: Harvard Discovers What Federal Money Costs
item.description: The Trump administration’s overreaching demands of Harvard are merely a symptom of excessive federal involvement in universities.

item.title: Some Parents Get Charged For Their Kids’ Violence. Karmelo Anthony’s Got More Than $445K
item.description: While the Anthonys get to go home to their ankle-braceleted son, the Metcalf family is mourning the loss of their beloved son and brother.

item.title: Marco Rubio’s Disingenuous Explanation of the Abrego Garcia Case
item.description: It is inconceivable that the secretary of state is unaware the man had a legal right against deportation to El Salvador that was enforceable in court.

item.title: Leftists Use Dishonest Language To Ram Through Ballot Measures. SCOTUS Has A Chance To Stop It
item.description: Activists often use deceptive language to trick the public on meaning of ballot initiatives, a RITE spokesman said.

item.title: Book Review: Quantitative Risk and Portfolio Management: Theory and Practice
item.description: This book fills a unique gap between the CFA curriculum and the growing demand to find model-driven investment management solutions.

item.title: Rebalancing’s Hidden Cost: How Predictable Trades Cost Pension Funds Billions
item.description: Rebalancing may help portfolios stay on target, but its predictability comes at a cost.

item.title: Big Funds, Small Gains: Rethinking the Endowment Playbook
item.description: Endowments heavily invested in alternatives are falling well behind low-cost indexed portfolios.
